title: Capacitor - E-field and U when dielectric is added

content.question:
An isolated, charged, parallel-plate capacitor initially has air in the gap between its plates. A dielectric material is then inserted to fill the gap. When the dielectric is added to the capacitor, do the magnitude of the electric field between the plates and the electric potential energy stored in the capacitor become greater or less?
Magnitude of Electric FieldElectric Potential EnergyAGreaterGreaterBGreaterLessCLessGreaterDLessLess

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
